content: Lishan Yang's Homepage Services Teaching Students Funding Publications Home Lishan Yang (杨丽杉) Assistant Professor George Mason University Department of Computer Science Email: lyang28 AT gmu.edu Office: ENGR 4610 My research interest mainly falls in system reliability and GPU architecture. I received a Ph.D. degree in the Department of Computer Science at William & Mary in 2022, under the supervision of Prof. Evgenia Smirni. Before coming to W&M, I got my bachelor's degree in computer science from University of Science and Technology of China (USTC) in 2016. Check my CV here >>>>>>>>> Spring 2026 CS 672 Computer Systems Performance Evaluation The syllabus is here. The focus of CS 672 is Systems - and how to measure a system. We will cover the performance measurement from theory to practice, but, with an emphasize of getting your hands dirty. If you worry about math: CS 672 does have some math - limitation, probability, distributions, confidence interval, etc - That's all. No hard math... Also, when we put math into a practical problem, math might not be as difficult as you thought :P What you will learn from this course: How to measure your system, how to find bottlenecks, how to convince people your software has good performance, how to estimate the maximum possible gain of your idea, etc. To me, performance evaluation covers a lot of useful techniques that are essential to every SDE and researcher. >>>>>>>>> I am at capacity for hiring new graduate students. I am *only* looking for GMU undergraduate students who are interested in joining my lab and getting their hands dirty on system research. However, for any student from anywhere, if you want some general advices or if you have some confusions, for example, research, career path, rejected papers, not getting along with your advisor, etc, you are welcome to send an email to me and I will find some time for a quick chat. Sometimes an outsider helps; I got many help from various (random) outsiders during my PhD study. ------ I am serving as the Student Activities Co-chair for ACM SIGMETRICS 2026. This year we plan to have: 1) Student Travel Grant, 2) Student Research Competition (SRC), 3) Student Mentoring Program, 4) Student Mentoring Lunch, and 5) Shadow PC.
